bibl.title: Letter from Louisa C. Richardson to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 5, 1925

div1.p: Richardson, Edsall's assistant, seeks confirmation that Kissinger was a volunteer in the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Louisa C. Richardson to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 5, 1925
div1.opener:
DAVID L. EDSALL, M.D.
Dean
WORTH HALE, M.D.
Assistant Dean
HARVARD UNIVERSITY
MEDICAL SCHOOL
Boston 17, Massachusetts
January 5, 1925
Col. J. R. Kean, U.S.A. Retired,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
Re: John R. Kissinger
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Dr. Edsall asks me to say that he is very grateful
for your assistance in ascertaining the address of John R.
Kissinger, late Private, Company D, 157th Indiana Infantry,
and Acting Hospital Steward, Hospital Corps, U.S.A.

I suppose there is no doubt but that the John R.
Kissinger referred to in Captain Jerome Clark's report is
the same man who volunteered for the yellow fever service.

Dr. Edsall would be very grateful, however, if you
could send him a statement to this effect, or direct him
where to obtain a statement to this effect.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Louisa C. Richardson
For the Dean. LCR:MM
Copy of correspondence enclosed.
